entry.title: Bitcoin Core 25.1 released
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core version v25.1 is now available for download from the official website (https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-25.1/) or through BitTorrent using the magnet link provided in the email. This release includes bug fixes, performance improvements, and updated translations. Users are encouraged to report any bugs they encounter using the GitHub issue tracker.To upgrade to the latest version, users running older versions should first shut down their current version and wait for it to completely shut down. Then, on Windows, they can run the installer, while on macOS, they can simply copy over the `/Applications/Bitcoin-Qt` directory. On Linux, they need to copy `bitcoind` or `bitcoin-qt`. Upgrading from an End of Life (EOL) version is possible but may require additional time for data directory migration. However, old wallet versions of Bitcoin Core are generally supported.Bitcoin Core is extensively tested and supported on Linux systems with the Linux kernel, macOS 10.15+, and Windows 7 and newer. While it should also work on most other Unix-like systems, it is not recommended to use Bitcoin Core on unsupported systems.The notable changes in this release include parallel compact block downloads, improvements to fee estimation, fixes for bech32 address handling, crash error fix when calling `/deploymentinfo`, bug fixes related to wallet address book migration, descriptors, and invalid scripts migration, as well as various build-related fixes.Other changes include improvements in CI (Continuous Integration) processes, such as pruning dangling images, using podman stop instead of podman kill, and switching to an amd64 container in the "ARM" task. The credits section acknowledges the contributions of individuals who directly contributed to this release, including Abubakar Sadiq Ismail, Andrew Chow, Bruno Garcia, Gregory Sanders, Hennadii Stepanov, MacroFake, Matias Furszyfer, Michael Ford, Pieter Wuille, stickies-v, and Will Clark. Additionally, thanks are given to those who assisted with translations.In conclusion, Bitcoin Core v25.1 is now available for download, offering bug fixes, performance improvements, and updated translations. Users are encouraged to upgrade to this version and report any bugs they encounter via the GitHub issue tracker. The release is supported on various operating systems, including Linux, macOS, and Windows, although it is not recommended to use it on unsupported systems. Notable changes in this release include enhancements to P2P, fee estimation, RPC, REST, wallet functionality, build processes, GUI, and miscellaneous improvements. CI processes have also been improved, and credits are given to individuals who contributed to this release.
